repricingcom.label: Competitive Repricing [USA]
repricingcom.comment:
Competitive Repricing

Competitive Repricing compares the price you are selling a product for against those of your competitors. You can automatically reprice your products within strict boundaries (maximum price and minimum price) to undercut your competitors by one pence / one cent, making your listing display as 'top of the pile' on Amazon by default. You will also be able to create a 'blacklist' of sellers whom you feel you are not in competition with simply by entering their store name.

undercut_value.label: Value to undercut by:
undercut_value.comment: To undercut by one pence/cent enter 0.01 for example

ignore_sellers.label: Custom list of sellers to ignore:
ignore_sellers.comment: Enter a comma separated list of sellers to disregard e.g. mytopcameras,topseller22,foobar

minimum_price_attribute.label: Minimum price attribute:
minimum_price_attribute.comment: Product attribute which contains the minimum Amazon selling price

competitive_price_attribute.label: Calculated price attribute:
competitive_price_attribute.comment: Product attribute into which to save the calculated price

exclude_feedback_below.label: Exclude sellers with feedback score less than [0.0-5.0]:

exclude_ratings_below.label: Exclude sellers with less than x ratings:
exclude_ratings_below.comment: Sellers with less than the entered number of ratings are excluded

shipping_rate.label: Standard Shipping Price for Calculation:
shipping_rate.comment: This shipping price will be subtracted from the item price to ensure that you become the cheapest after shipping price is added by Amazon. Please enter a decimal number without spaces or currency signs, or alternatively enter a product attribute code

pricing.label: Price Control
pricing.comment:
Pricing Control

We have made it easier to control the price which is sent to Amazon for each of your products. Below are a series of options to help you to manage your pricing:

Price Inflation Percentage: Add an attribute to your products on Magento and then into this attribute enter a percentage of the website price which you would like to add to the price published to Amazon. Then, enter the attribute code in the box below. For example, if a toy is sold for 5.00 on your Magento store, you may wish to add 0.50 on top of this price when selling on Amazon. To do this, you would set the value of the attribute selected to 10. This will add 10% to the original price, which would make the final price 5.50.

Price Inflation Value: Add an attribute to your products on Magento and then into this attribute enter a currency value (without a currency symbol) which you would like to add to the price published to Amazon. Then, enter the attribute code in the box below. For example, if a toy is sold for 5.00 on your Magento store, you may wish to add 0.50 on top of this price when selling on Amazon. To do this, you would set the value of the attribute selected to 0.50. This will add 0.50 to the original price, which would make the final price 5.50. Please note that if used in combination with the above percentage inflation, percentage inflation will occur first.

Add Tax Percentage to Catalog Prices: If you have entered all of your product prices excluding tax, you should use this setting to quickly increase the prices of your products for Amazon by the Tax percentage you charge on your items.

Follow 'Special Prices': Control whether you would like the module to follow 'special prices' on your store. If set to 'Enabled' and used in combination with the above inflation rules, the inflation rules will occur on the 'special price'.

Custom Price: Add an attribute to your products and then enter the attribute code below. You can then set a completely custom price for your Amazon listings by entering a value for this attribute and enabling custom prices below.

value_inflation_attribute.label: Attribute code for value based inflation:

enabled_add_tax.label: Add tax percentage to catalog price:

standard_product_id.label: Standard Product Identifier
standard_product_id.comment:
What is a Standard Product Identifier

The Amazon Catalogue retains its accuracy by generally only allowing products to be listed when a 'standard product identifier' is provided. There are exceptions to this rule, but generally only products which have a UPC, EAN or ISBN (or an amazon-assigned ASIN) identifier can be listed on Amazon.

We have developed the Find Products on Amazon Wizard as an attempt at reducing the need for you to have this information about your products to hand. This tool searches Amazons expansive database for matches based on product name, manufacturer part number, or any other piece of information you have on the product.

If the Find Products on Amazon Wizard fails to locate your product however, you may be required by Amazon to supply a standard product identifer for your products. To make this as easy as possible, the two form fields below allow you to specify a product attribute code containing your standard product identifiers and Product Identifier type this attribute contains.

Don't worry if you only have values for some products in this attribute; if no value is found for a product, the module will still attempt to submit your product data.

Merchants who have an exception from using these codes may ignore this section of the configuration area.

productidcodetype.label: Product ID Type
productidcodetype.comment: Can be one of the following: ISBN ASIN EAN GTIN UPC

productidmap.label: Product ID Attribute
productidmap.comment: Please enter the code for the attribute containing this information

show_disabled.label: Show Disabled Products
show_disabled.comment: Set this option to Disabled to hide all disabled products in every view and export within the module

hide_help_tips.label: Hide Help Tips
hide_help_tips.comment: Advanced users may wish to hide some of the help tips embedded within the screens of this module. You may do this by setting this to Enabled

import_time_as_order_time.label: Use time order was placed on Amazon when importing orders
import_time_as_order_time.comment: If set to enabled the order will appear to have been placed on Magento at the time it was placed on Amazon

shiponcomplete.label: Send shipment to Amazon when shipment is first made?
shiponcomplete.comment: Set to 'Disable' if you enter tracking information for your shipments

emailfullxmldebug.label: E-mail Full XML Messages
emailfullxmldebug.comment: Enter an e-mail address to which a copy of the XML messages should be sent

customqtymapping.label: Custom Qty Mapping
customqtymapping.comment: Enter a product attribute which contains the quantity value to send to Amazon (optional)

stopselllimit.label: Stop Sell Limit Attribute
stopselllimit.comment: Enter a product attribute which contains the quantity value, once reached, causes the product to stop selling on Amazon (optional)

orderhistorydays.label: Number of days of past orders to import
orderhistorydays.comment: Enter a number of days history for which to import orders from Amazon. The default value is 3

repricedebugpid.label: Product ID to inspect repricing
repricedebugpid.comment: Enter a product ID for a product for which you want to inspect the repricing calculation. This is emailed to the same email address as the full XML feed debug messages

stockfrequency.label: Stock update frequency
stockfrequency.comment: Enter the frequency stock updates are sent to Amazon when enabled

pricefrequency.label: Price update frequency
pricefrequency.comment: Enter the frequency price updates are sent to Amazon when enabled

amazoncom.label: Amazon USA Settings
amazoncom.comment:
Amazon USA Integration

In order to use this module as of v2.0, you must first authorise the module to access your Amazon Seller Central account. To do so, please click on the link below and log into your account.

After logging in, select 'I want to use an application to access my Amazon seller account with MWS.' and click 'Next'.
Click here

On completion, please enter the value Merchant ID below.

quicksetuptaxcode.label: Product Tax Code for Find Products on Amazon products
quicksetuptaxcode.comment: To submit a product tax code with your Find Products on Amazon products, enter the code here, must be one of A_GEN_TAX or A_GEN_NOTAX.
